39300127.review:
It took 17 years, but I finally finished the main game.  They either made it easier or I magically got better, but either way, it's nice to know that the whole acid trip... still makes no sense.

In any case, the original Rez came out in 2001 and is very much in tact, which is good news for people who weren't able to find it.  It became a rare collector's item and wouldn't see the light of day again until 2008 in the form of Rez HD on the 360/PS3.  Even then, area 2 continued to wail on me so hard that I could never make it past area 3.  Finally, in 2017, we got to see this game return once again and I have finally managed to see the end of the original game.

I guess there's some new stuff, too, but whatever.  The albatross is dead!

39218765.review:
Rez Infinite is the first game to ever make me consider buying a VR headset.  Whether that’s praise for the game or a burn for VR, it doesn’t take away from the fact that it’s great even without it.  However, it’s probably fair to say that the newly crafted Unreal-Engine-based portion (Area X) that was added in this release is the thing I’d most want to experience with that fully 3D perspective.  While both the original game and Area X are great, the original game and its extra modes make up the bulk of what is generally fairly limited overall gameplay.

[h1]The ‘Original’ Spectacle of Visuals and Music[/h1]

Ok, so maybe Rez wasn’t the first game to embrace the idea of gameplay that combined visuals and music, but it certainly did it in unique way that even today has few comparative titles.  At its core it’s a simple rail shooter that has you moving a cursor around the screen to lock on to enemies and their weak points (up to eight at a time) and firing off projectiles to take them out.  The thing that set it apart from similarly designed arcade rail shooters was a powerful onslaught of colors and designs in a sort of graffiti style as you flew by.  This combined with the seemingly magical way that your shots would synchronize with the game’s purpose-made soundtrack to make an experience that was completely unlike anything out there at the time on the Dreamcast or Playstation 2.

After the initial re-release of the game in HD on the Xbox 360, it finally came to PC with the addition of the aforementioned “Area X” added.  This version has all of the original gameplay with higher resolutions and 3D audio.  Area X uses the some of the same mechanics from the original game such as locking on to enemies with a cursor to fire off shots, but differs by removing the rails and allowing the player to move forward and backward at will while steering and aiming the character.  This presents a very distinct feel in the gameplay (that is hampered by the odd default controls) which gives a clear impression that you are playing something new, but still feels well within the Rez universe.  On top of that, the massive leap in visuals and the addition of heavily layered backing songs made for some downright jaw dropping moments of visual and auditory grandeur. 

[h1]Short, but Sweet[/h1]

Since the core game of Rez has only five main levels, it’s possible, if not probable, that you will finish the main part of the game in under a couple of hours.  In addition, much of the game was very easy, especially when using the mouse as your controls as I don’t believe it was designed for such dexterity.  It can feel particularly disappointing given the $25 base price tag.  However, Rez does have a number of challenge-based unlocks and some additional items that you can do after beating the game.  It even has high score options for each level that you can compare with other players and your friends on the scoreboard.   The difficulty does also ramp up toward the end (perhaps to its detriment) as the last level is much longer when including the final boss fight with its many stages.  I’ve read that this may be a result of the game’s hidden dynamic difficulty system, but since it’s hidden I can’t really say if anything was actually different.

 [h1]An Experience Worthy of Experiencing[/h1]

It’s difficult to describe Rez Infinite as anything more or less than just a raw “experience.”  For all that I got out of it playing on my regular ol’ 2D monitor, I believe I’d get ten times more trying it out in VR.  Just sitting a few feet from my screen with my headphones on, I was still completely engrossed in the visuals and the musical interaction – even without a (probably awkward) secondary controller to make use of the game’s “Trance Vibrator” functionality that is supposed to vibrate with the beat of the music.  I can only imagine how intense the full experience would be in VR.  Yet, without even seeing it in VR, I have to recommend this based solely on what I *could* do, and to me it seemed well worth it from start to finish.  But without a doubt if you have the VR equipment available, this is a must-buy to make use of that investment.  I will say that the price does seem a bit high for the amount of content even including the extra stuff and replayability though, so I also suggest getting Rez Infinite on sale since it’s already coming down in price fairly regularly.  

If you'd like to see more of my reviews, check out my curator page here: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28346672-Endyo-Gaming/

39096634.review:
I can't say enough good things about Rez. 

I've played every iteration of this game and still enjoy coming back to see how much better it's gotten, as well as any tweaks that've changed over time. 

Rez is a great rail shooter, the music is diverse and awesome electronica, and the unlocks you achieve for your efforts are interesting additions. 

I don't have a VR setup at the time of writing this but I can imagine you'd be able to swim in the sensations of the music and gameplay. I look forward to playing more once I do.

39059508.review: Rez é mais do que um jogo: é uma experiência fantástica, aperfeiçoada com a possibilidade de jogar com o mouse. Não ouse jogar sem fones de ouvido, ou sem um sistema de som potente. Antes de jogar, achava que Rez jamais poderia superar Panzer Dragoon, mas agora vejo que supera, e muito. Extremamente recomendado.

39057435.review:
i never played the original PS2 Rez. In fact, i had never even heard of it until the PS VR announcement, which got so many people excited. I decided to check it out because of the crazy neon graphics and the fact that I hadn't played what i thought would be a fun simple shooter in a long time. 
Rez Infinite in VR amazed me. It's honestly probably the most psychedellic sober experience you could ever have. The controls are amazing, the music is great, the level design, artwork and story (as intentionally light and vague as it is) are all great and the way they work together (the music with the gameplay+ The atmosphere the graphics and music create together) are great. 
This game legitimately made me sit down and contemplate the origin of existence while also making me want to continue to shoot cool virus robots until i couldn't see. I had fun, and it made me think. That might not sound like a lot, but it's rare for a game this obscure and cheap to actually affect me in this way.
For the  main game, i'd say 9 or 10 out of 10. Definitely buy and play in VR.

outside of the main story, there's also a new "area x" developed by the porters of the reboot, and its...different. But pretty good. I didn't think the music was as fitting in area x as the rest of the main game, and the transition from On Rails Shooting in the original game to free user controlled flight in this one was dissorienting at first, but pretty fine and fun by the end. It just didn't really feel like Rez. It was definitely a seperate experience on its own, but pretty good. It was also cool to see the Rez style updated to modern Unreal Engine 4 technology

To Recap:
Original Rez in VR: 9.5/10
Rez Area X: 7/10
Should you buy Rez Infinite? Y E S !

One of my favorite games of all time - this is the fourth time I've bought it, and I want a modern sequel more than anything.

Everyone owes it to themselves to play this masterpiece.

40714994.review:
Classic Rez from the PS2 with a new level of immersion and depth thanks to VR, one of the best experiences in VR to date. Must have if you own the Oculus, Vive, or Windows Mixed Reality Headset. The new content found in Area X will leaving you wanting more the second you finish it, Rez better get a fully realized modern VR title like that showin in X or they wasted a huge amount of potential. 

Rez X if built upon could be a hardware seller if they expand upon it enough, as is with only one stage in the Area X section it will still give you chills and blow your mind.  If its on a Steam special you have no excuse to not pick it up. Sony get on that asap!

40247229.review:
I LOVE Rez!  I have loved it since I played it on the Sega Dreamcast.  The PS2 port didn't quite have the same feel.  This port is wonderful because you can use the mouse!  Playing the game with a controler was great in it's day.  But, I am so glad they let you use the mouse!  You can move so much easier now.  You would think the game would be easier like this;  however, the game adapts to your playing level.  It can tell a pro from a novice.  I suspect it has something to do with your shooting accuracy throughout the level.  The building soundtrack through the levels is awesome.  The tracks are ageless.

Area X

Reminds me bit of Child of Eden -- the sequel to Rez.  I wonder if it's coming to Steam as well.  

GET THIS MASTER PIECE

They have upgraded the graphics, yet stayed true to it's roots.  

AWESOME JOB TEAM!

40039173.review:
奶牛关评测原文：https://cowlevel.net/game/Rez_Infinite/review/2661797

谢谢奶牛和作者提供的key！

0825

这个游戏似乎挺有年头和来历，通过阅读其他玩家的评价，我才知道它是一款重置游戏。第一次开玩的时候，夏威夷大佬路过见到画面说他当年读研的时候玩过这款游戏，挺不错的。

我：貌似这个游戏支持VR！

大佬：哦，你有VR吗？我在夏威夷有套设备，可惜太阳能供电不足经常#￥%GYUD……

我：……没有。只去过体验店尝试了一把而已。

于是开启了又一次大佬围观引发其他开发也来围观我个手残打游戏的日常场景。

刚开始并没有意识到这个游戏的操作，可以用摇杆最多标记6个攻击对象，然后再释放技能。偶尔移动飘忽不定，摇杆似乎要被我捏爆，就像段誉的技能时灵时不灵。当然，后续尝试慢慢就上手，手残表示很满足。

在AreaX的模式下，偶尔飘到某个场景小人会停下来，不知道该往哪里飞。这个时候我也没辙了……只能退出再登入。在Rez模式下目前被卡在了第二关，boss每每把我打回球体，biubiubiu就挂掉了。通关的文字闪得太快，想阅读总是来不及。其实是挺好奇这个游戏的背景设定的，感谢其他玩家在评价里的各种详细描述，谢谢啦喵！~

之所以评为神作的原因是因为音乐很棒，Rez模式下没有那么深刻的体验，但是在AreaX模式下，自己在星空（一片漆黑的源码世界？）里发射出的音符，好带感哈哈哈。因为游戏节奏不慢，大部分时间停不下来，总有种节奏随着心脏跳，一旦超过心率，就好激动好激动太爽啦哈哈哈哈。

这游戏已成为最近工作午休的三大娱乐之一（撸猫，看剧，玩Rez）。

此外，十分抱歉……我从来没试过录播自己玩的游戏，也许找天可以试试嗯……就是……手残……操作……有什么好看的啊想想就好难过了QAQ

39860812.review:
So now all you need is an Xbox- or PS-style controller to enjoy this game as originally intended* - 

And VR headsets for everybody, or a wall projector and a thumping soundsystem, any of which are only a few hundred of your dollars.

One playthrough is TV-length but unforgettable - you may wish to buy it on sale.

You play it with your wireless mouse, with the Trance Vibrating(tm) controller on your lap if you're alone or on the most sexually attractive person's** lap otherwise, or get them to swap. 

Either way's good!

It's even better if you're on [censored] or [censored] or in a space-time where [censored] is permitted, but you can still have a great vanilla experience.

*My Steam Controller does not vibrate properly. 0/0

**"Person" includes any sentient, semi-sentient or pseudo-sentient entities.

39805850.review: Un bello juego con un diseño unico y una alta rejugabilidad si eres fan de la música electronica de este tipo

39668901.review: This is the second time I bought Rez (last time was the Xbox live arcade Rez HD release). I don't regret buying it a second time. The game is the perfect hybrid of an on-rails shooter, a music game, and a psychedelic light show. Even owning the HD remaster of Rez, this edition is completely worth it due to the VR option and Area X. The music, the graphics, the gameplay. I can't think of any other game that produces the states of mind this game does (in all of the right ways). I hope Area X is expanded some day into a full game. I haven't played this game in true VR yet myself but I gifted the game to my game developer brother in law and he was blown away by the VR and said that it is hands down the best VR experience he has ever had (though he complained about some of the perspective settings being off and disorientating if you are new to VR).

39668250.review:
I've owned Rez on every system since my dreamcast when I was a kid. One of my all time favorite games. Area X feels so good in VR. The old levels are neat to see, although it can feel like VR is tacked on sometimes. Especially with the Area 3 boss, the aiming feels a bit off since the wall it creates with 4 things to shoot before they hit you, can get way to close way to fast.

But the soundtrack still holds up, Area 5 and Area X will always be a highlight of my life. And it's easy enough for someone to pick up and have a go at.
